results.title: Oasis in space: what price progress?
results.creator_credit: Andrew W Sott, Andrew Solt Productions, Costeau Society Production and Philippe Cousteau
results.brief_description: Affects of pollution (asbestos) on drinking water in area of Silver bay in US. Goes through how they analyse content of water and methods of how to reverse the situation of environmental disaster. Narrator, Philippe Cousteau.

results.title: Oasis in space: visions of tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Educational Media Corporation, Andrew Solt Productions, Cousteau Society, Andrew Solt and Philippe Cousteau
results.brief_description:
Discussion of technological and scientific developments which lead to predictions of what the future may be like. Concentrates on the history of the Space Age - space flight, astronomy, scientific innovations, the effect of space technology on Earth’s economic development; marine life and the preservation of endangered species.
Narrated by Philippe Cousteau.

results.title: Oasis in space: troubled waters
results.creator_credit: Andrew Solt Productions, Cousteau Society, Andrew Solt and Philippe Cousteau
results.brief_description: Several environmentalists including Margaret Mead and Isaac Asimov discuss what needs to be done in order to reverse the polluted state of our waters. Narrated by Philippe Cousteau.

results.title: Oasis in space: population time-bomb
results.brief_description: Discussion of world growth and how this affects economy, health, wealth and social conditions of world communities. Focuses on exponential growth, discussing the fast growth rate of the world; developing world countries affected by poverty, covering different viewpoints and theories; historical and political uprisings such as El Salvador etc. Discuses the methods of overcoming population growth in poorer countries through education and health. Different view points are expressed including those of: Dr Margaret Mead, Carl Sagan. Paul Ehrlich, Isaac Asimov and Yves Cousteau.

results.title: Oases: for city dwellers
results.brief_description: Shows some of the national parks of Western Germany which have been created to preserve the beauty of the landscapes as well as to provide beautiful peaceful recreational areas free from the noise and bustle of the industrial areas.

results.title: Oakie Doke and the orchestra
results.brief_description: Oakie Doke is the friendly problem solving soul of Oakie Hollows. Made from oak leaves, twigs and acorns, he is the one who gets things done. Included on this tape are 5 adventures; OAKIE DOKE AND THE HAT HUNT; Granny Annie loses her hat in the lily pond. Oakie devises a fishing competition with a crate of ginger beer as reward to the one who can find the hat; OAKIE DOKE AND THE SCOOTER; Oakie invents a scooter based on one of his favourite novels. There’s trouble when some mischievous squirrels hijack his new toy; OAKIE DOKE AND THE CHEEKY BREEZE; a cheeky wind wreaks havoc with Milly Mole’s washing as flying sheets have the residents of Oakie Hollows seeing ghosts and pirate ship sails; OAKIE DOKE AND THE ORCHESTRA; while collecting bottles for Granny Annie’s lemonade, Oakie invents musical instruments out of household items. There’s problems with the lemonade too, as baking powder has been used instead of sugar, causing the bottle to explode! OAKIE DOKE AND THE TREASURE HUNT; when the animals come to Oakie complaining of being bored he invents a treasure hunt to chase their boredom away. All stories are written by Jimmy Hibbert, with music by Ernie Wood.

results.title: O.H.M.S.: royal visit to Australia 1963
results.brief_description: The royal visit of the Queen and Duke of Edinburgh to all Australian states in 1963. Shows a respresentative selection of the engagements undertaken by the Royal couple, and the behind the scenes activities of the Australian Post Office related to the visit. Also shows some good archival footage of the “south bank” area in Melbourne before the complex was developed. Narrated by T. Horton.

results.title: O.D.2. - I cannot negotiate
results.brief_description: The second of two programmes showing the application of Organizational Development theory in the running of Sheldon High School, Oregon, USA. Shows what happens when there is dissension among the decision making body and the various ways that O.D. is used to resolve the situation.

results.title: O.D.1. - We have consensus
results.brief_description: Organizational Development (O.D.) ia a major revolutionary and controversial management theory in America, whose influence is beginning to be felt in Britain and Europe. Shows application of O.D. in the running of Sheldon High School, Oregon, USA.

results.title: O Panama
results.creator_credit: New Television Workshop, WGBH-TV, Boston, Susan Dowling and Burt Barr
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: O Panama, scripted by Burt Barr and filmed by James Benning, was made for TV. Immigrant (Willem Dafoe) comes to New York from an unidentified Latin American country and appears to fall ill in the middle of winter. He drifts through this illness, confined to his apartment where his imagination is free. The tedious reality of the sickness and the vivid hallucinatory visions of his delirium, are stitched together by the polarities of light and dark, hot and cold, sound and silence, day and night, presence and absence. There is no dialogue and little action as a `mental landscape…rife with heat and color’ emerges from the backdrop of a bleak urban winterscape.
